description: The trap will be sent when Redundancy Set Status become Master.

event.Summary: SRD redundancy set $v3 transitioned from $v4 to $v6

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDRdeundancySetStateTransition JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancyPeerIPAddressType i 0 JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancyPeerIPAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetID s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetOldState s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetEvent s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetNewState s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE

description: The Peer IP address Type of the Redundancy Group.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancyPeerIPAddressType

description: The Peer IP address of the Redundancy Group.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancyPeerIPAddress

description: Redundancy Set ID.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetID

description: Redundancy Set Old State.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetOldState

description: Redundancy Set Event.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetEvent

description: Redundancy Set New State.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancySetNewState

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone
closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the
value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation

description: The textual identification of the contact person for
this managed node, together with information on how
to contact this person. If no contact information is
known, the value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact

description: The trap will be sent when Redundancy Set gets action error
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDRdeundancySetActionError JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancyActionErrorCode s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapNotificationMessage s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE

description: Redundancy Set Old State.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapRedundancyActionErrorCode

description: Redundancy Set notification messages.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SRD-MIB::jnxSRDTrapNotificationMessage

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g., 'telephone
closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the
value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysLocation

description: The textual identification of the contact person for
this managed node, together with information on how
to contact this person. If no contact information is
known, the value is the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysContact
